LJ001-0001|LJSpeech|{P R IH1 N T IH0 NG sp IH1 N DH IY0 OW1 N L IY0 S EH1 N S W IH1 DH sp W IH1 CH W IY1 AA1 R AE1 T P R EH1 Z AH0 N T K AH0 N S ER1 N D sp D IH1 F ER0 Z sp F R AH1 M M OW1 S T IH1 F N AA1 T F R AH1 M AO1 L DH IY0 AA1 R T S AH0 N D K R AE1 F T S R EH2 P R IH0 Z EH1 N T IH0 D IH1 N DH IY0 EH2 K S AH0 B IH1 SH AH0 N}|Printing, in the only sense with which we are at present concerned, differs from most if not from all the arts and crafts represented in the Exhibition.
LJ001-0002|LJSpeech|{IH1 N B IY1 IH0 NG K AH0 M P EH1 R AH0 T IH0 V L IY0 M AA1 D ER0 N}|in being comparatively modern.
LJ001-0003|LJSpeech|{F AO1 R AO2 L DH OW1 sp DH AH1 CH AY0 N IY1 Z T UH1 K IH0 M P R EH1 SH AH0 N Z sp F R AH1 M W UH1 D B L AA1 K S sp IH0 N G R EY1 V D IH1 N R IH0 L IY1 F sp F ER0 S EH1 N CH ER0 IY0 Z B IH0 F AO1 R DH AH0 W UH1 D K AH2 T ER0 Z AH1 V DH AH0 N EH1 DH ER0 L AH0 N D Z sp B AY1 AH0 S IH1 M AH0 L ER0 P R AA1 S EH2 S}|For although the Chinese took impressions from wood blocks engraved in relief for centuries before the woodcutters of the Netherlands, by a similar process.
LJ001-0004|LJSpeech|{P R AH0 D UW1 S T DH AH0 B L AA1 K B UH1 K S sp W IH1 CH W ER1 DH IY0 IH0 M IY1 D IY0 AH0 T P R EH1 D AH0 S EH2 S ER0 Z AH0 V DH AH0 T R UW1 P R IH1 N T AH0 D B UH1 K}|produced the block books, which were the immediate predecessors of the true printed book,
LJ001-0005|LJSpeech|{DH IY0 IH0 N V EH1 N SH AH0 N AH0 V M UW1 V AH0 B AH0 L M EH1 T AH0 L L EH1 T ER0 Z IH0 N DH AH0 M IH1 D AH0 L AH1 V DH AH0 F IH0 F T IY1 N TH S EH1 N CH ER0 IY0 sp M EY1 JH AH1 S T L IY0 B IY1 K AH0 N S IH1 D ER0 D sp AE1 Z DH IY0 IH0 N V EH1 N SH AH0 N AH0 V DH IY0 AA1 R T AH0 V P R IH1 N T IH0 NG}|the invention of movable metal letters in the middle of the fifteenth century may justly be considered as the invention of the art of printing.
LJ001-0006|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D sp IH1 T IH1 Z W ER1 TH M EH1 N SH AH0 N IH1 N P AE1 S IH0 NG sp DH AE1 T sp AE1 Z AE1 N IH0 G Z AE1 M P AH0 L AH1 V F AY1 N T AH0 P AA1 G R AH0 F IY0}|And it is worth mention in passing that, as an example of fine typography,
LJ001-0007|LJSpeech|{DH IY0 ER1 L IY0 AH0 S T B UH1 K P R IH1 N T IH0 D W IH1 TH M UW1 V AH0 B AH0 L T AY1 P S sp DH IY0 G UW1 T AH0 N B ER0 G sp AO1 R sp F AO1 R T IY0 T UW1 L AY1 N B AY1 B AH0 L sp AH1 V AH0 B AW1 T F AO1 R T IY1 N F IH1 F T IY0 F AY1 V}|the earliest book printed with movable types, the Gutenberg, or "forty-two line Bible" of about fourteen fifty-five,
LJ001-0008|LJSpeech|{HH AE1 Z N EH1 V ER0 B IH1 N S ER0 P AE1 S T}|has never been surpassed.
LJ001-0009|LJSpeech|{P R IH1 N T IH0 NG DH EH1 N F AO1 R AW1 ER0 P ER1 P AH0 S sp M EY1 B IY1 K AH0 N S IH1 D ER0 D EH1 Z DH IY0 AA1 R T AH1 V M EY1 K IH0 NG B UH1 K S sp B AY1 M IY1 N Z AH0 V M UW1 V AH0 B AH0 L T AY1 P S}|Printing, then, for our purpose, may be considered as the art of making books by means of movable types.
LJ001-0010|LJSpeech|{N AW1 sp AE1 Z AO1 L B UH1 K S sp N AA1 T P R AY0 M EH1 R AH0 L IY0 IH0 N T EH1 N D IH0 D EH1 Z sp P IH1 K CH ER0 B UH1 K S sp K AH0 N S IH1 S T P R IH1 N S IH0 P L IY0 AH0 V T AY1 P S K AH0 M P OW1 Z D sp T AH0 F AO1 R M L EH1 T ER0 P R EH2 S}|Now, as all books not primarily intended as picture-books consist principally of types composed to form letterpress,
LJ001-0011|LJSpeech|{IH1 T IH1 Z AH1 V DH AH1 F ER1 S T IH0 M P AO1 R T AH0 N S sp DH AE1 T DH AH0 L EH1 T ER0 Y UW1 Z D SH UH1 D B IY1 F AY1 N IH0 N F AO1 R M}|it is of the first importance that the letter used should be fine in form;
LJ001-0012|LJSpeech|{AH0 S P EH1 SH AH0 L IY0 AE1 Z N OW1 M AO1 R T AY1 M IH0 Z AA1 K Y AH0 P AY2 D sp AO1 R K AA1 S T IH0 N K ER1 D sp IH1 N K AE1 S T IH0 NG sp S EH1 T IH0 NG sp AO1 R P R IH1 N T IH0 NG B Y UW1 T AH0 F AH0 L L EH1 T ER0 Z}|especially as no more time is occupied, or cost incurred, in casting, setting, or printing beautiful letters.
LJ001-0013|LJSpeech|{DH AE1 N IH1 N DH AH1 S EY1 M AA2 P ER0 EY1 SH AH0 N Z W IH1 DH AH1 G L IY0 W AH1 N Z}|than in the same operations with ugly ones.
LJ001-0014|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D IH1 T W AH1 Z AH0 M AE1 T ER0 AH0 V K AO1 R S DH AE1 T sp IH1 N DH AH0 M IH1 D AH0 L EY1 JH IH0 Z sp W EH1 N DH AH1 K R AE1 F T S M EH0 N T UH1 K K EH1 R DH AE1 T B Y UW1 T AH0 F AH0 L F AO1 R M SH UH1 D AO1 L W IY0 Z B IY1 AH0 P AA1 R T AH0 V sp DH EH1 R P ER0 D AH1 K SH AH0 N Z sp HH W AH2 T EH1 V ER0 DH EY1 W ER0}|And it was a matter of course that in the Middle Ages, when the craftsmen took care that beautiful form should always be a part of their productions whatever they were,
LJ001-0015|LJSpeech|{DH AH1 F AO1 R M Z AH0 V P R IH1 N T AH0 D L EH1 T ER0 Z SH UH1 D B IY0 B Y UW1 T AH0 F AH0 L sp AH0 N D DH AE1 T DH EH1 R ER0 EY1 N JH M AH0 N T AO1 N DH AH0 P EY1 JH sp SH UH1 D B IY1 R IY1 Z N AH0 B AH0 L sp AH0 N D AH0 HH EH1 L P T IH0 DH AH0 SH EY1 P L IY0 N AH0 S AH0 V DH AH1 L EH1 T ER0 Z DH AH0 M S EH1 L V Z}|the forms of printed letters should be beautiful, and that their arrangement on the page should be reasonable and a help to the shapeliness of the letters themselves.
LJ001-0016|LJSpeech|{DH AH1 M IH1 D AH0 L EY1 JH IH0 Z B R AO1 T K AH0 L IH1 G R AH0 F IY0 sp T UW1 P ER0 F EH1 K SH AH0 N sp AE1 N D sp IH1 T W AH1 Z N AE1 CH ER0 AH0 L DH EH1 R F AO2 R}|The Middle Ages brought calligraphy to perfection, and it was natural therefore.
LJ001-0017|LJSpeech|{DH AE1 T DH AH1 F AO1 R M Z AH0 V P R IH1 N T AH0 D L EH1 T ER0 Z SH UH1 D F AA1 L OW0 M AO1 R ER0 L EH1 S K L OW1 S L IY0 DH OW1 Z AH0 V DH AH1 R IH1 T AH0 N K EH1 R IH0 K T ER0 sp AH0 N D DH EY1 F AA1 L OW0 D DH AH0 M V EH1 R IY0 K L OW1 S L IY0}|that the forms of printed letters should follow more or less closely those of the written character, and they followed them very closely.
LJ001-0019|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D W IH1 CH D IH0 V EH1 L AH0 P T M AO1 R K AH0 M P L IY1 T L IY0 AH0 N D S AE2 T IH0 S F AE1 K T R AH0 L IY0 AA1 N DH AH1 S AY1 D AH0 V DH AH1 L OW1 ER0 K EY1 S sp DH AE1 N DH IY0 K AE1 P AH0 T AH0 L L EH1 T ER0 Z}|and which developed more completely and satisfactorily on the side of the "lower-case" than the capital letters;
LJ001-0020|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 L OW1 ER0 K EY1 S B IY1 IH0 NG IH1 N F AE1 K T IH0 N V EH1 N T IH0 D sp IH1 N DH IY0 ER1 L IY0 M IH1 D AH0 L sp EY1 JH IH0 Z}|the "lower-case" being in fact invented in the early Middle Ages.
LJ001-0021|LJSpeech|{DH IY0 ER1 L IY0 AH0 S T B UH1 K sp P R IH1 N T IH0 D W IH1 TH M UW1 V AH0 B AH0 L T AY1 P sp DH IY0 AH0 F AO1 R S EH2 D G UW1 T AH0 N B ER0 G B AY1 B AH0 L sp IH1 Z P R IH1 N T AH0 D IH1 N L EH1 T ER0 Z sp W IH1 CH AA1 R AH0 N IH0 G Z AE1 K T IH2 M AH0 T EY1 SH AH0 N}|The earliest book printed with movable type, the aforesaid Gutenberg Bible, is printed in letters which are an exact imitation.
LJ001-0022|LJSpeech|{AH1 V DH AH1 M AO1 R F AO1 R M AH0 L IH0 K L IY2 Z IY0 AE1 S T IH0 K AH0 L R AY1 T IH0 NG sp W IH1 CH AH0 B T EY1 N D AE1 T DH AE1 T T AY1 M sp DH IH1 S HH AE1 Z S IH1 N S B IH1 N K AO1 L D M IH1 S AH0 L T AY1 P}|of the more formal ecclesiastical writing which obtained at that time; this has since been called "missal type,"

LJ001-0024|LJSpeech|{B AH1 T DH AH1 F ER1 S T B AY1 B AH0 L sp AE1 K SH AH0 L IY0 D EY1 T IH0 D sp W IH1 CH AO1 L S OW0 W AH1 Z P R IH1 N T AH0 D AE1 T M EY1 N T S B AY1 P IY1 T ER0 SH OW1 F ER0 sp IH1 N DH IY0 Y IH1 R F AO1 R T IY1 N S IH1 K S T IY0 T UW1}|But the first Bible actually dated (which also was printed at Maintz by Peter Schoeffer in the year fourteen sixty-two)
LJ001-0025|LJSpeech|{IH1 M AH0 T EY2 T S AH0 M AH1 CH F R IY1 ER0 HH AE1 N D sp S IH1 M P L ER0 sp R AW1 N D ER0 AE1 N D L EH1 S S P AY1 K IY0 sp AE1 N D DH EH1 R F AO2 R F AA1 R P L EH1 Z AH0 N T ER0 sp AE1 N D IY1 Z IY0 ER0 T UW1 R IY1 D}|imitates a much freer hand, simpler, rounder, and less spiky, and therefore far pleasanter and easier to read.
LJ001-0027|LJSpeech|{AH0 S P EH1 SH AH0 L IY0 EH1 Z R IH0 G AA1 R D Z DH AH1 L OW1 ER0 K EY1 S L EH1 T ER0 Z sp AE1 N D sp T AY1 P V EH1 R IY0 S IH1 M AH0 L ER0 W AH1 Z Y UW1 Z D D Y UH1 R IH0 NG DH AH0 N EH1 K S T F IH1 F T IY1 N AO1 R T W EH1 N T IY0 Y IH1 R Z sp N AA1 T OW1 N L IY0 B AY1 SH OW1 F ER0}|especially as regards the lower-case letters; and type very similar was used during the next fifteen or twenty years not only by Schoeffer,

LJ001-0029|LJSpeech|{B AH1 T sp DH OW1 AO1 N DH AH1 HH OW1 L sp IH0 K S EH1 P T IH1 N IH1 T AH0 L IY0 sp G AA1 TH IH0 K L EH1 T ER0 W AH1 Z M OW1 S T AO1 F AH0 N Y UW1 Z D}|But though on the whole, except in Italy, Gothic letter was most often used.
LJ001-0030|LJSpeech|{AH0 V EH1 R IY0 F Y UW1 Y IH1 R Z sp S AO1 DH AH1 B ER1 TH AH0 V R OW1 M AH0 N K EH1 R IH0 K T ER0 sp N AA1 T OW1 N L IY0 IH0 N IH1 T AH0 L IY0 sp B AH1 T IH1 N JH ER1 M AH0 N IY0 AH0 N D F R AE1 N S}|a very few years saw the birth of Roman character not only in Italy, but in Germany and France.

LJ001-0033|LJSpeech|{B AH1 T W IH1 CH M AH1 S T S ER1 T AH0 N L IY0 HH AE1 V K AH1 M F R AH1 M DH AH0 S T AH1 D IY0 AH1 V sp DH AH0 T W EH1 L F TH sp AO1 R IY1 V IH0 N DH IY0 sp IH0 L EH1 V AH0 N TH S EH1 N CH ER0 IY0 sp M EH1 S}|but which must certainly have come from the study of the twelfth or even the eleventh century MSS.
LJ001-0034|LJSpeech|{DH EY1 P R IH1 N T IH0 D V EH1 R IY0 F Y UW1 B UH1 K S IH0 N DH IH1 S T AY1 P sp TH R IY1 OW1 N L IY0 sp B AH1 T sp IH1 N DH EH1 R V EH1 R IY0 F ER1 S T B UH1 K S IH1 N R OW1 M sp B IH0 G IH1 N IH0 NG W IH1 TH DH IY0 Y IH1 R F AO1 R T IY1 N S IH1 K S T IY0 EY1 T}|They printed very few books in this type, three only; but in their very first books in Rome, beginning with the year fourteen sixty-eight,
LJ001-0035|LJSpeech|{DH EY1 D IH0 S K AA1 R D IH0 D DH IH1 S F AO1 R AH0 M AO1 R K AH0 M P L IY1 T L IY0 R OW1 M AH0 N sp AE1 N D F AA1 R L EH1 S B Y UW1 T AH0 F AH0 L L EH1 T ER0}|they discarded this for a more completely Roman and far less beautiful letter.

LJ001-0042|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D DH OW1 M AO1 R R OW1 M AH0 N DH AE1 N DH AE1 T sp Y EH1 T S K EH1 R S L IY0 M AO1 R L AY1 K DH IY0 K AH0 M P L IY1 T R OW1 M AH0 N T AY1 P AH1 V DH IY0 ER1 L IY0 AH0 S T P R IH1 N T ER0 Z AH0 V R OW1 M}|and though more Roman than that, yet scarcely more like the complete Roman type of the earliest printers of Rome.

LJ001-0047|LJSpeech|{AH1 V JH EH1 N S AH0 N IH1 T M AH1 S T B IY1 S EH1 D sp DH AE1 T HH IY1 K AE1 R IY0 D DH IY0 D IH0 V EH1 L AH0 P M AH0 N T AH0 V R OW1 M AH0 N T AY1 P EH1 Z F AA1 R EH1 Z IH1 T K AH0 N G OW1}|Of Jenson it must be said that he carried the development of Roman type as far as it can go:
LJ001-0048|LJSpeech|{HH IH1 Z L EH1 T ER0 IH0 Z AE1 D M ER0 AH0 B L IY0 K L IH1 R AE1 N D R EH1 G Y AH0 L ER0 sp B AH1 T sp AE1 T L IY1 S T EH1 Z B Y UW1 T AH0 F AH0 L AE1 Z EH1 N IY0 AH1 DH ER0 R OW1 M AH0 N T AY1 P}|his letter is admirably clear and regular, but at least as beautiful as any other Roman type.
LJ001-0049|LJSpeech|{AE1 F T ER0 HH IH1 Z D EH1 TH IH1 N DH AH0 F AO1 R T IY1 N sp EY1 T IY0 Z sp AO1 R AE1 T L IY1 S T B AY1 F AO1 R T IY1 N sp N AY1 N T IY0 sp P R IH1 N T IH0 NG IH1 N V EH1 N AH0 S HH AE1 D D IH0 K L AY1 N D V EH1 R IY0 M AH1 CH}|After his death in the "fourteen eighties," or at least by fourteen ninety, printing in Venice had declined very much;
LJ001-0050|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D sp DH OW1 DH AH1 F EY1 M AH0 S F AE1 M L IY0 AH1 V AA1 L D IH0 S sp R IH0 S T AO1 R D IH1 T S T EH1 K N IH0 K AH0 L sp EH1 K S AH0 L AH0 N S sp R IH0 JH EH1 K T IH0 NG B AE1 T ER0 D L EH1 T ER0 Z}|and though the famous family of Aldus restored its technical excellence, rejecting battered letters,
LJ001-0051|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D sp P EY1 IH0 NG G R EY1 T AH0 T EH1 N SH AH0 N T UW1 DH AH0 P R EH1 S W ER1 K sp AO1 R AE1 K SH AH0 L P R AA1 S EH2 S AH0 V P R IH1 N T IH0 NG}|and paying great attention to the "press work" or actual process of printing,
LJ001-0052|LJSpeech|{Y EH1 T DH EH1 R T AY1 P IH1 Z AA0 R T IH1 S T IH0 K L IY0 AA1 N AH0 M AH1 CH L OW1 ER0 L EH1 V AH0 L DH AH0 N JH EH1 N S AH0 N sp EH1 S sp AE1 N D IH1 N F AE1 K T}|yet their type is artistically on a much lower level than Jenson's, and in fact.
LJ001-0053|LJSpeech|{DH EY1 M AH1 S T B IY1 K AH0 N S IH1 D ER0 D sp T UW1 HH AE1 V sp EH1 N D IH0 D DH IY0 EY1 JH AH1 V F AY1 N P R IH1 N T IH0 NG IH1 N IH1 T AH0 L IY0}|they must be considered to have ended the age of fine printing in Italy.
LJ001-0054|LJSpeech|{JH EH1 N S AH0 N HH AW2 EH1 V ER0 sp HH AE1 D M EH1 N IY0 K AH0 N T EH1 M P ER0 EH2 R IY0 Z HH UW1 Y UW1 Z D sp B Y UW1 T AH0 F AH0 L T AY1 P}|Jenson, however, had many contemporaries who used beautiful type,
LJ001-0056|LJSpeech|{IH1 T W AH1 Z DH IY1 Z G R EY1 T V AH0 N IY1 SH AH0 N P R IH1 N T ER0 Z T AH0 G EH1 DH ER0 W IH1 DH DH EH1 R B R EH1 DH R AH0 N AH0 V R OW1 M sp M IH0 L AA1 N}|It was these great Venetian printers, together with their brethren of Rome, Milan,
LJ001-0057|LJSpeech|{P AA1 R M AH0 sp AH0 N D HH W AH1 N AO1 R T UW1 AH1 DH ER0 S IH1 T IY0 Z sp HH UW1 P R AH0 D UW1 S T DH AH0 S P L EH1 N D AH0 D IH0 D IH1 SH AH0 N Z AH0 V DH AH0 K L AE1 S IH0 K S sp W IH1 CH AA1 R W AH1 N AH0 V DH AH0 G R EY1 T G L AO1 R IY0 Z AH0 V DH AH1 P R IH1 N T ER0 Z AA1 R T}|Parma, and one or two other cities, who produced the splendid editions of the Classics, which are one of the great glories of the printer's art,
LJ001-0058|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D AA1 R W ER1 DH IY0 R EH2 P R IH0 Z EH1 N T AH0 T IH0 V Z sp AH1 V DH IY0 IY1 G ER0 IH0 N TH UW1 Z IY0 AE2 Z AH0 M sp F R ER0 DH AH1 R IH0 V AY1 V D L ER1 N IH0 NG AH1 V DH AE1 T EH1 P AH0 K sp B AY1 F AA1 R}|and are worthy representatives of the eager enthusiasm for the revived learning of that epoch. By far,
LJ001-0059|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 G R EY1 T ER0 P AA1 R T AH0 V DH IY1 Z IH0 T AE1 L Y AH0 N P R IH1 N T ER0 Z sp IH1 T SH UH1 D B IY0 M EH1 N SH AH0 N D sp W ER1 JH ER1 M AH0 N Z AO1 R F R EH1 N CH M EH0 N sp W ER1 K IH0 NG AH1 N D ER0 DH IY0 IH1 N F L UW0 AH0 N S AH0 V IH0 T AE1 L Y AH0 N AH0 P IH1 N Y AH0 N AE1 N D EY1 M Z}|the greater part of these Italian printers, it should be mentioned, were Germans or Frenchmen, working under the influence of Italian opinion and aims.
LJ001-0060|LJSpeech|{IH0 T M AH1 S T B IY1 AH2 N D ER0 S T UH1 D sp DH AE1 T sp TH R UW1 DH AH1 HH OW1 L AH1 V DH AH0 F IH0 F T IY1 N TH sp AE1 N D DH AH1 F ER1 S T K W AO1 R T ER0 sp AH1 V DH IY0 S IH1 K S T IY1 N TH S EH1 N CH ER0 IY0 Z}|It must be understood that through the whole of the fifteenth and the first quarter of the sixteenth centuries.
LJ001-0061|LJSpeech|{DH AH1 R OW1 M AH0 N L EH1 T ER0 W AH0 Z Y UW1 Z D S AY1 D B AY1 S AY1 D W IH1 TH DH AH0 G AA1 TH IH0 K}|the Roman letter was used side by side with the Gothic.
LJ001-0062|LJSpeech|{IY1 V IH0 N IH1 N IH1 T AH0 L IY0 sp M OW1 S T AH0 V DH AH0 TH IY2 AH0 L AA1 JH IH0 K AH0 L AE1 N D L AA1 B UH1 K S W ER0 P R IH1 N T IH0 D IH0 N G AA1 TH IH0 K L EH1 T ER0}|Even in Italy most of the theological and law books were printed in Gothic letter,
LJ001-0063|LJSpeech|{W IH1 CH W AH0 Z JH EH1 N ER0 AH0 L IY0 M AO1 R F AO1 R M AH0 L IY0 G AA1 TH IH0 K sp DH AE1 N DH AH1 P R IH1 N T IH0 NG AH0 V DH AH0 JH ER1 M AH0 N W ER1 K M IH0 N}|which was generally more formally Gothic than the printing of the German workmen,
LJ001-0064|LJSpeech|{M EH1 N IY0 AH0 V HH UW1 Z T AY1 P S IH0 N D IY1 D L AY1 K DH AE1 T AH0 V sp DH IY0 S UW0 B IY1 AH0 K OW0 W ER1 K S sp AA1 R AH1 V AH0 T R AE0 N Z IH1 SH AH0 N AH0 L K EH1 R IH0 K T ER0}|many of whose types, indeed, like that of the Subiaco works, are of a transitional character.

LJ001-0067|LJSpeech|{IH1 N DH AH0 L OW1 K AH1 N T R IY0 Z AE1 N D K AH0 L OW1 N sp W IH1 CH W ER0 V EH1 R IY0 F ER1 T AH0 L sp AH1 V P R IH1 N T IH0 D B UH1 K S sp G AA1 TH IH0 K W AA1 Z DH AH0 F EY1 V ER0 IH0 T}|In the Low Countries and Cologne, which were very fertile of printed books, Gothic was the favorite.

LJ001-0070|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D W AH1 Z Y UW1 Z D DH EH1 R W IH1 DH V EH1 R IY0 L IH1 T AH0 L V EH2 R IY0 EY1 SH AH0 N sp AO1 L TH R UW1 DH AH1 S IH1 K S T IY1 N TH AE1 N D S EH1 V AH0 N T IY1 N TH S EH1 N CH ER0 IY0 Z sp AH0 N D IH0 N D IY1 D sp IH1 N T UW0 DH IY0 EY1 T IY1 N TH}|and was used there with very little variation all through the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries, and indeed into the eighteenth.

LJ001-0073|LJSpeech|{W EH1 N T AA1 N AH0 P EY1 S sp AE1 N D B AY1 DH IY0 EH1 N D AH0 V DH IY0 S IH1 K S T IY1 N TH S EH1 N CH ER0 IY0 sp DH EH1 R W AH1 Z N OW1 R IY1 L IY0 B Y UW1 T AH0 F AH0 L P R IH1 N T IH0 NG D AH1 N}|went on apace; and by the end of the sixteenth century there was no really beautiful printing done:
LJ001-0074|LJSpeech|{DH AH1 B EH1 S T M OW1 S L IY0 F R EH1 N CH sp AO1 R L OW1 K AH1 N T R IY0 sp W AH1 Z N IY1 T AE1 N D sp K L IH1 R sp B AH1 T W IH0 DH AW1 T EH1 N IY0 D IH0 S T IH1 NG K SH AH0 N}|the best, mostly French or Low-Country, was neat and clear, but without any distinction;

LJ001-0076|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D TH IH1 NG Z G AA1 T W ER1 S AH0 N D W ER1 S sp TH R UW1 DH AH1 HH OW1 L AH1 V DH IY0 S EH1 V AH0 N T IY1 N TH S EH1 N CH ER0 IY0 sp S OW1 DH AE1 T sp IH1 N DH IY0 EY1 T IY1 N TH sp P R IH1 N T IH0 NG sp W AH1 Z V EH1 R IY0 M IH1 Z ER0 AH0 B L IY0 P ER0 F AO1 R M D}|and things got worse and worse through the whole of the seventeenth century, so that in the eighteenth printing was very miserably performed.
LJ001-0078|LJSpeech|{T UW1 IH0 M P R UW1 V DH AH0 L EH1 T ER0 IH1 N F AO1 R M}|to improve the letter in form.

LJ001-0125|LJSpeech|{DH IH1 S IH1 Z DH AH0 N EH1 R OW0 IH0 NG AH0 V DH AH1 M AA1 D ER0 N L EH1 T ER0 Z}|this is the narrowing of the modern letters.
LJ001-0126|LJSpeech|{M OW1 S T AH0 V JH EH1 N S AH0 N EH1 S L EH1 T ER0 Z AA1 R D IH0 Z AY1 N D W IH0 DH IH1 N AH0 S K W EH1 R}|Most of Jenson's letters are designed within a square,

LJ001-0128|LJSpeech|{IH1 T IH1 Z N AA1 T AH0 R IY1 L G EY1 N sp F AO1 R DH AH1 M AA1 D ER0 N P R IH1 N T ER0 TH R OW1 Z DH IY0 G EY1 N AH0 W EY1 sp B AY1 P UH1 T IH0 NG sp IH0 N AO1 R D AH0 N AH0 T L IY0 W AY1 D S P EY1 S IH0 Z B IY0 T W IY1 N HH IH1 Z L AY1 N Z sp W IH1 CH P R AA1 B AH0 B L IY0}|it is not a real gain, for the modern printer throws the gain away by putting inordinately wide spaces between his lines, which, probably,
LJ001-0129|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 L AE1 T ER0 AH0 L K AH0 M P R EH1 SH AH0 N AH0 V HH IH1 Z L EH1 T ER0 Z sp R EH1 N D ER0 Z sp N EH1 S AH0 S EH2 R IY0}|the lateral compression of his letters renders necessary.
LJ001-0130|LJSpeech|{K AH0 M ER1 SH AH0 L IH2 Z AH0 M sp AH0 G EH1 N K AH0 M P EH1 L Z DH IY0 Y UW1 S AH0 V T AY1 P T UW1 S M AO1 L IH0 N S AY1 Z sp T UW1 B IY1 K AH1 M F ER0 T AH0 B AH0 L R IY1 D IH0 NG}|Commercialism again compels the use of type too small in size to be comfortable reading:

LJ001-0179|LJSpeech|{IY1 V IH0 N W EH1 N DH AH0 W UH1 D K AH2 T S AA1 R V EH1 R IY0 R UW1 D IH0 N D IY1 D}|even when the woodcuts are very rude indeed,

LJ003-0010|LJSpeech|{W AY1 N AE1 N D B IH1 R M AY1 T B IY1 HH AE1 D IH1 N EH1 N IY0 K W AA1 N T AH0 T IY0 sp DH IY0 OW1 N L IY0 L IH2 M IH0 T EY1 SH AH0 N B IY1 IH0 NG}|wine and beer might be had in any quantity, the only limitation being.

No account was taken of the amount of liquors admitted in one day,
LJ003-0012|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D sp D EH1 T ER0 Z M AY1 T P R AE1 K T AH0 K L IY0 HH AE1 V EH1 Z M AH1 CH EH1 Z DH EY1 L AY1 K T sp IH1 F DH EY1 K UH1 D OW1 N L IY0 P EY1 F AO1 R IH0 T}|and debtors might practically have as much as they liked, if they could only pay for it.

LJ003-0014|LJSpeech|{K W AA1 R AH0 L IH0 NG AH0 M AH1 NG DH AH0 D EH1 T ER0 Z W AH0 Z N AA1 T sp AH0 N F R IY1 K W AH0 N T sp B L OW1 Z W ER0 S T R AH1 K sp AE1 N D F AY1 T S sp AO1 F AH0 N IH0 N S UW1 D}|Quarreling among the debtors was not unfrequent. Blows were struck, and fights often ensued.

Other light literature besides the daily journals were in circulation:

LJ008-0062|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D DH IH1 S F L AO1 R IH1 Z S AH0 P AO1 R T IH0 D B IH0 L OW1}|and this floor is supported below,

LJ008-0254|LJSpeech|{IH1 T W AH0 Z F AA1 L OW0 D B AY1 DH IY0 D IY1 P sp AE1 N D S AA1 L AH0 M sp B UW1 M IH0 NG AH1 V DH IY0 D EH1 TH B EH1 L sp F R AH1 M DH AH1 CH ER1 CH AH0 V S EY1 N T S EY0 P UW0 L K ER0}|It was followed by the deep and solemn booming of the death-bell from the church of St. Sepulchre.
LJ008-0255|LJSpeech|{DH IY0 AY1 ER0 N N EH1 L sp DH AE1 T R AE1 NG AH0 P AA1 N DH AH0 B IY1 T IH0 NG HH AA1 R T AH1 V DH AH1 L IH1 V IH0 NG M AE1 N sp HH UW1 W AH1 Z AH0 B AW1 T T IH0 D AY1}|the iron knell that rang upon the beating heart of the living man who was about to die;
LJ008-0256|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D W IH1 TH B L AE1 N CH T CH IY1 K sp AE1 N D S IH1 NG K IH0 NG sp W IY1 T ER1 N D AH0 W EY1 F ER0 M DH IY0 S IY1 N}|and with blanched cheek, and sinking, we turned away from the scene.
LJ008-0257|LJSpeech|{IH1 N DH AH1 S D IH0 S K R AY1 B IH0 NG DH IY0 S AE1 T ER0 N EY1 L Y AH0 B IH0 F AO1 R DH IY0 G AE1 L OW0 Z sp AY1 HH AE1 V B IH1 N D R AO1 N AO1 N sp S AH1 M W AH1 T B IY2 AO1 N D DH AH0 P IH1 R IY0 AH0 D W IH1 DH sp W IH1 CH sp AY1 AE1 M AE1 T P R EH1 Z AH0 N T D IY1 L IH0 NG}|In thus describing the saturnalia before the gallows I have been drawn on somewhat beyond the period with which I am at present dealing.
LJ008-0258|LJSpeech|{L EH1 T M IY1 R IY0 T R EY1 S M AY1 S T EH1 P S sp AE1 N D S P IY1 K M AO1 R IH1 N D IY1 T EY0 L AH1 V DH AH0 T R IY1 T M AH0 N T AH0 V DH AH0 K AH0 N D EH1 M D IH1 N DH OW1 Z B L AH1 D TH ER2 S T IY0 sp AE1 N D B R UW1 T AH0 L IY0 sp IH0 N D IH1 F R AH0 N T D EY1 Z}|Let me retrace my steps, and speak more in detail of the treatment of the condemned in those bloodthirsty and brutally indifferent days,
LJ008-0259|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D AH0 V DH EH1 R D IH0 M IY1 N ER0 sp AE1 F T ER0 S EH1 N T AH0 N S AH0 N T IH1 L DH AH1 L AE1 S T P EH1 N AH0 L T IY0 W AH0 Z P EY1 D}|and of their demeanor after sentence until the last penalty was paid.

LJ008-0264|LJSpeech|{B AH1 T DH AH1 M ER1 D ER0 ER0 Z F AO1 R M D OW1 N L IY0 AH0 S M AO1 L P R AH0 P AO1 R SH AH0 N sp AH1 V DH AH0 T OW1 T AH0 L N AH1 M B ER0 S EH1 N T AH0 N S T T UW1 D EH1 TH sp AE1 N D F AO1 R DH AH0 R EH1 S T sp DH EH1 R W AH1 Z AH0 L AO1 NG P IH1 R IY0 AH0 D AH0 V AE1 NG K SH AH0 S sp S AH0 S P EH1 N S}|But the murderers formed only a small proportion of the total number sentenced to death, and for the rest there was a long period of anxious suspense,

LJ008-0294|LJSpeech|{N IH1 R L IY0 IH0 N D EH1 F AH0 N AH0 T L IY0 D IH0 F ER1 D}|nearly indefinitely deferred.

LJ008-0298|LJSpeech|{S AH1 M T AY2 M Z DH AH0 R IH0 P AO1 R T W AH0 Z D IH0 L EY1 D}|Sometimes the report was delayed.
LJ008-0299|LJSpeech|{AA1 N W AH1 N AH0 K EY1 ZH AH0 N M IH1 S T ER0 W EY1 K F IY2 L D T EH1 L Z AH1 S sp DH AH0 R IH0 K AO1 R D ER0 sp HH UW1 HH AE1 D AH0 T EH1 N D AH0 D DH IY0 K AW1 N S AH0 L AE1 T W IH1 N Z ER0 sp D IH0 D N AA1 T D IH0 L IH1 V ER0 DH AH0 R IH0 P AO1 R T T IH1 L DH AH1 F AA1 L OW0 IH0 NG sp D EY1}|On one occasion, Mr. Wakefield tells us, the Recorder, who had attended the council at Windsor, did not deliver the report till the following day.

LJ009-0046|LJSpeech|{B AH1 T DH IY0 AH0 T EH1 M P T F EY1 L Z sp HH IY1 T R EH1 M B AH0 L Z sp HH IH1 Z N IY1 Z N AA1 K T AH0 G EH1 DH ER0 sp AH0 N D HH IH1 Z HH EH1 D D R UW1 P S AE1 Z HH IY1 EH1 N T ER0 Z DH AH0 K AH0 N D EH1 M D sp P Y UW1}|but the attempt fails; he trembles, his knees knock together, and his head droops as he enters the condemned pew.
LJ009-0047|LJSpeech|{DH AH1 N EH1 K S K AA1 N V IH0 K T IH1 Z K L IH1 R L IY0 AE1 N D AH2 N M IH0 S T EY1 K AH0 B L IY0 AH0 V IH1 L AH0 N}|The next convict is clearly and unmistakably a villain.
LJ009-0048|LJSpeech|{HH IY1 IH1 Z AH0 HH AA1 R D AH0 N D sp AH0 F EH1 N D ER0 sp P R IY1 V IY0 AH0 S L IY0 K AE1 S T F R ER0 L AY1 F sp R IY0 P R IY1 V D sp T R AE0 N S P AO1 R T AH0 D T UW1 AO0 S T R EY1 L Y AH0 sp AE1 N D S IH1 N S R IY0 T ER1 N D W IH0 TH AW1 T P AA1 R D AH0 N}|He is a hardened offender, previously cast for life, reprieved, transported to Australia, and since returned without pardon.
LJ009-0049|LJSpeech|{F R ER0 DH IH1 S AH0 F EH1 N S DH AH0 sp P AH1 N IH0 SH M AH0 N T IH0 Z D EH1 TH}|For this offense the punishment is death.
LJ009-0050|LJSpeech|{HH IY1 HH AE1 Z HH AW2 EH1 V ER0 D AH1 B L IY0 ER1 N D HH IH1 Z S EH1 N T AH0 N S sp AE1 N D IH1 Z AE1 K SH AH0 L IY0 K AH0 N D EH1 M D F R ER0 B ER1 G L ER0 IY0 K AH0 M IH1 T AH0 D S IH1 N S HH IH0 Z ER0 AY1 V AH0 L IH0 N IH1 NG G L AH0 N D}|He has, however, doubly earned his sentence, and is actually condemned for burglary committed since his arrival in England.
LJ009-0051|LJSpeech|{HH IH1 Z L UH1 K AE1 T DH AH1 SH EH1 R AH0 F S AE1 N D DH IY0 AO1 R D AH0 N EH2 R IY0 IH0 Z F UH1 L AH1 V S K AO1 R N sp AE1 N D D IH0 F AY1 AH0 N S}|His look at the sheriffs and the ordinary is full of scorn and defiance.

LJ009-0053|LJSpeech|{B AH1 T HH UW1 IH1 Z L EH1 F T T IH0 D AY1 AA1 N DH AH1 S AH2 P AH0 Z IH1 SH AH0 N DH AE1 T DH IH1 S IH0 Z sp N AA1 T HH IH1 Z F ER1 S T K AH0 N V IH1 K SH AH0 N sp AE1 N D S T IH1 L M AO1 R B IH0 K AH1 Z AH0 G UH1 D M EH1 N IY0 SH IY1 P sp HH AE1 V AH1 V L EY1 T B IH0 N S T OW1 L AH0 N B AY1 AH1 DH ER0 P IY1 P AH0 L}|but who is left to die on the supposition that this is not his first conviction, and still more because a good many sheep have of late been stolen by other people.
LJ009-0054|LJSpeech|{HH IY1 IH1 Z K W AY1 T K AH0 N T EH1 N T sp T IH0 D AY1}|He is quite content to die;
LJ009-0055|LJSpeech|{IH0 N D IY1 D DH IY0 CH AE1 P L AH0 N AE1 N D AH1 DH ER0 Z HH AE1 V B R AO1 T HH IH1 M F ER1 M L IY0 T UW1 B IH0 L IY1 V DH AE1 T HH IH1 Z S IH2 CH UW0 EY1 SH AH0 N IH1 Z EH1 N V IY0 AH0 B AH0 L sp AH0 N D DH AE1 T DH IY0 G EY1 T S AH0 V HH EH1 V AH0 N sp AA1 R OW1 P AH0 N T AH0 R AH0 S IY1 V HH IH1 M}|indeed the chaplain and others have brought him firmly to believe that his situation is enviable, and that the gates of heaven are open to receive him.
LJ009-0056|LJSpeech|{DH AH1 L AE1 S T AH0 V DH AH0 F AO1 R IH1 Z S EH1 D T UW1 HH AE1 V B IH1 N AH0 K L ER1 JH IY0 M AE2 N sp AH1 V DH AH0 CH ER1 CH AH0 V IH1 NG G L AH0 N D sp K AH0 N D EH1 M D F ER0 F AO1 R JH ER0 IY0 sp AH0 M IH1 Z ER0 AH0 B AH0 L OW1 L D M AE1 N IH1 N AH0 T AE1 T ER0 D S UW1 T AH1 V B L AE1 K}|The last of the four is said to have been a clergyman of the Church of England, condemned for forgery, "a miserable old man in a tattered suit of black.
LJ009-0057|LJSpeech|{AO0 L R EH1 D IY0 HH IY1 IH1 Z HH AE1 F D EH1 D}|Already he is half dead.
LJ009-0058|LJSpeech|{G R EY1 T EH1 F ER0 T S HH AE1 V B IH1 N M EY1 D T AH0 S EY1 V HH IH1 Z L AY1 F}|Great efforts have been made to save his life.

LJ009-0104|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 W IH1 M AH0 N S EH1 T AH1 P EY1 Y EH1 L sp W IH1 CH IH1 Z M IH1 K S T W IH1 TH AH0 R AH1 S L IH0 NG N OY1 Z sp AH0 K EY1 ZH AH0 N D B AY1 DH AH1 R IH0 M UW1 V AH0 L AH1 V DH OW1 Z HH UW1 Z HH IH2 S T EH1 R IH0 K S HH AE1 V EH1 N D IH0 D IH1 N F EY1 N T IH0 NG}|the women set up a yell, which is mixed with a rustling noise, occasioned by the removal of those whose hysterics have ended in fainting.

In seventeen eighty-six a mad woman, Margaret Nicholson,
LJ010-0148|LJSpeech|{T R AY1 D T IH0 S T AE1 B JH AO1 R JH DH AH0 TH ER1 D sp AE1 Z HH IY1 W AH0 Z AH0 L AY1 T IH0 NG F R AH1 M HH IH1 Z K AE1 R IH0 JH sp AE1 T DH IY0 G EY1 T AH0 V S EY1 N T JH EY1 M Z IH0 Z P AE1 L AH0 S}|tried to stab George the third as he was alighting from his carriage at the gate of St. James's Palace.

By Arthur Griffiths. Section eighteen: Newgate notorieties continued, part three.
LJ015-0002|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 K AO1 R S AH0 V DH AH0 S W IH1 N D L ER0 Z W AH1 Z B AY1 N OW1 M IY1 N Z S M UW1 DH sp B AH1 T IH1 T W AH1 Z N AA1 T T IH1 L EY1 T IY1 N F IH1 F T IY0 F AO1 R sp DH AE1 T S AH0 S P IH1 SH AH0 N ER0 OW1 Z DH AH0 T EH1 N IY0 TH IH2 NG W AH0 Z R AO1 NG}|The course of the swindlers was by no means smooth, but it was not till eighteen fifty-four that suspicion arose that anything was wrong.
LJ015-0003|LJSpeech|{AH0 F ER1 M W IH1 CH HH EH1 L D AH0 L AA1 T AH0 V W AO1 R AH0 N T S sp S AH1 D AH0 N L IY0 D IH0 M AE1 N D IH0 D DH AH0 D IH0 L IH1 V ER0 IY0 AH0 V DH AH0 G UH1 D Z DH EY1 K AH1 V ER0 D}|A firm which held a lot of warrants suddenly demanded the delivery of the goods they covered.
LJ015-0004|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 G UH1 D Z HH AE1 V IH0 NG N OW1 IH0 G Z IH1 S T AH0 N S sp K OW1 L AH1 V K AO1 R S K UH1 D N AA1 T D IH0 L IH1 V ER0 DH EH1 M}|The goods having no existence, Cole of course could not deliver them.
LJ015-0005|LJSpeech|{AH0 B AW1 T DH IH1 S T AY1 M D EY1 V IH0 D S AH0 N AH0 N D G AO1 R D AH0 N DH AH0 P IY1 P AH0 L AH0 B AH1 V M EH1 N SH AH0 N D}|About this time Davidson and Gordon, the people above-mentioned,
LJ015-0006|LJSpeech|{HH UW1 HH AE1 D F R AO1 JH AH0 L AH0 N T W AO1 R AH0 N T S sp AW1 T AH0 V DH EH1 R OW1 N sp T UW1 DH IY0 IH0 K S T EH1 N T AH0 V HH W AH1 N HH AH1 N D R AH0 D F IH1 F T IY0 TH AW1 Z AH0 N D P AW1 N Z sp S AH0 S P EH1 N D IH0 D P EY1 M AH0 N T sp AE1 N D AE0 B S K AA1 N D AH0 D}|who had fraudulent warrants out of their own to the extent of one hundred fifty thousand pounds, suspended payment and absconded.
LJ015-0007|LJSpeech|{DH IH1 S sp AH0 F EH1 K T IH0 D K OW1 L Z K R EH1 D IH0 T sp AE1 N D AH1 G L IY0 R IH0 P AO1 R T S W ER0 IH0 N S ER1 K Y AH0 L EY2 SH AH0 N sp CH AA1 R JH IH0 NG HH IH1 M W IH1 DH DH IY0 IH1 SH UW0 AH0 V S IH1 M Y AH0 L EY2 T IH0 D W AO1 R AH0 N T S}|This affected Cole's credit, and ugly reports were in circulation charging him with the issue of simulated warrants.
LJ015-0008|LJSpeech|{DH IY1 Z IH0 N D IY1 D sp W ER0 AW1 T T UW1 DH AH0 V AE1 L Y UW0 AH1 V TH R IY1 HH AH1 N D R IH0 D S IH1 K S T IY0 S EH1 V AH0 N TH AW1 Z AH0 N sp EY1 T HH AH1 N D R AH0 D P AW1 N Z}|These indeed were out to the value of three hundred sixty-seven thousand, eight hundred pounds.
LJ015-0009|LJSpeech|{K OW1 L Z D IH1 F AH0 K AH0 L T IY0 Z IH0 N K R IY1 S T M AO1 R AH0 N D M AO1 R sp W AO1 R AH0 N T HH OW1 L D ER0 Z K EY1 M D AW1 N AH0 P AA1 N HH IH1 M D IH0 M AE1 N D IH0 NG T UW1 R IY1 AH0 L AY2 Z DH EH1 R G UH1 D Z}|Cole's difficulties increased more and more; warrant-holders came down upon him demanding to realize their goods.
LJ015-0010|LJSpeech|{K OW1 L N AW1 S AH0 S P EH1 N D IH0 D P EY1 M AH0 N T}|Cole now suspended payment.
LJ015-0011|LJSpeech|{M AE1 L T B IY0 sp HH UW1 HH AE1 D B OW1 L T IH0 D sp W AH1 Z P ER0 S UW1 D AE1 N D ER0 EH1 S T IH0 D sp T IH0 EH1 N D HH IH1 Z L AY1 F M IH1 Z ER0 AH0 B L IY0 sp B AY1 K AH0 M IH1 T IH0 NG S UW1 IH0 S AY2 D sp IH1 N EY1 N UW1 G EY0 T S EH1 L}|Maltby, who had bolted, was pursued and arrested, to end his life miserably by committing suicide in a Newgate cell.
LJ015-0012|LJSpeech|{K OW1 L T UW1 W AH1 Z AE2 P R IH0 HH EH1 N D AH0 D sp AH0 N D IH1 N D UW1 K AO1 R S sp T R AY1 D AE1 T DH AH0 S EH1 N T R AH0 L K R IH1 M AH0 N AH0 L K AO1 R T}|Cole too was apprehended, and in due course tried at the Central Criminal Court.
LJ015-0013|LJSpeech|{HH IY1 W AH0 Z F AW1 N D G IH1 L T IY0 sp AE1 N D S EH1 N T AH0 N S T T UW1 DH AH0 S IY1 M IH0 NG L IY0 IH0 N AE1 D AH0 K W AH0 T P AH1 N IH0 SH M AH0 N T sp AH1 V F AO1 R Y IH1 R Z T R AE2 N S P ER0 T EY1 SH AH0 N}|He was found guilty, and sentenced to the seemingly inadequate punishment of four years' transportation.
LJ015-0014|LJSpeech|{D EY1 V IH0 D S AH0 N AE1 N D G AO1 R D AH0 N sp W ER1 AO1 L S OW0 S EH1 N T AH0 N S T T UW1 IH0 M P R IH1 Z AH0 N M AH0 N T}|Davidson and Gordon were also sentenced to imprisonment.
LJ015-0015|LJSpeech|{AH0 M AO1 R D IH0 S T R EH1 S IH0 NG K EY1 S sp S T AE1 N D Z N EH1 K S T AA1 N DH AH0 K R IH1 M AH0 N AH0 L R EH1 K ER0 D Z}|A more distressing case stands next on the criminal records --
LJ015-0016|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 F EY1 L Y ER0 AE1 N D S AH1 B S AH0 K W AH0 N T S EH1 N T AH0 N S sp AH1 V DH AH0 B AE1 NG K ER0 Z M EH1 S ER0 Z sp S T R AE1 HH AH0 N sp P AO1 L AE1 N D B EY1 T S}|the failure and subsequent sentence of the bankers Messrs. Strahan, Paul, and Bates,
LJ015-0017|LJSpeech|{F AO1 R DH AH1 F R AO1 JH AH0 L AH0 N T D IH0 S P OW1 Z AH0 L AH1 V S IH0 K Y UH1 R AH0 T IY0 Z L AA1 JH D IH1 N DH EH1 R HH AE1 N Z sp DH IH1 S F ER1 M W AH1 Z W AH1 N AH0 V DH IY0 sp OW1 L D AH0 S T B AE1 NG K IH0 NG IY0 S T AE1 B L IH0 SH M AH0 N T S IH0 N DH IY0 K IH1 NG D AH0 M}|for the fraudulent disposal of securities lodged in their hands. This firm was one of the oldest banking establishments in the kingdom,
LJ015-0018|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D D EY1 T IH0 D B AE1 K T AH0 DH AH0 K AA1 M AH0 N W EH2 L TH sp W IH1 N sp AH1 N D ER0 DH AH0 T AY1 T AH0 L AH0 V S N OW1 AE1 N D W AO1 L T AH0 N sp IH1 T K AE1 R IY0 D AA1 N B IH1 Z N IH0 S AE1 Z P AO1 N B R OW1 K ER0 Z}|and dated back to the Commonwealth, when, under the title of Snow and Walton, it carried on business as pawnbrokers.
LJ015-0019|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 S T R AE1 HH AH0 N AH0 V DH AH1 F ER1 M W IH1 CH K EY1 M T UW1 G R IY1 F sp W AH1 Z AH0 S N OW1 sp HH UW1 sp CH EY1 N JH D HH IH1 Z N EY1 M sp F R ER0 AH0 F AO1 R CH AH0 N AH1 V T UW1 HH AH1 N D R AH0 D TH AW1 Z AH0 N D P AW1 N Z}|The Strahan of the firm which came to grief was a Snow who changed his name for a fortune of two hundred thousand pounds;
LJ015-0020|LJSpeech|{HH IY1 W AH0 Z AH0 M AE1 N IH0 S T IY1 M D AE1 N D R IH0 S P EH1 K T IH0 D IH0 N S AH0 S AY1 AH0 T IY0 sp AE1 N D DH AH0 W ER1 L D AH0 V F AY1 N AE2 N S sp IH0 N K EY1 P AH0 B AH0 L AE1 Z IH0 T W AH0 Z TH AO1 T sp AH1 V AH0 D IH0 S AA1 N AH0 S T D IY1 D}|he was a man esteemed and respected in society and the world of finance, incapable as it was thought of a dishonest deed.
LJ015-0021|LJSpeech|{S ER1 JH AA1 N D IY1 N P AO1 L sp HH AE1 D IH0 N HH EH1 R AH0 T IH0 D sp AH0 sp B EH2 R AH0 N EH1 T S IY0 F ER0 M HH IH1 Z sp F AA1 DH ER0 sp T AH0 G EH1 DH ER0 W IH1 DH AE1 N AA1 N ER0 D N EY1 M}|Sir John Dean Paul had inherited a baronetcy from his father, together with an honored name;
LJ015-0022|LJSpeech|{HH IY1 W AH1 Z HH IH0 M S EH1 L F sp AH0 P R AA1 M AH0 N AH0 N T M EH1 M B ER0 AH1 V DH AH1 L OW1 CH ER1 CH sp AH1 V AO0 S T IH1 R P AY1 AH0 T IY0 sp AE1 K T IH0 V IH0 N AO1 L G UH1 D W ER1 K S}|he was himself a prominent member of the Low Church, of austere piety, active in all good works.
LJ015-0023|LJSpeech|{M IH1 S T ER0 B EY1 T S HH AE1 D B IH1 N K AA2 N F AH0 D EH1 N SH AH0 L M AE1 N AH0 JH IH0 NG K L ER1 K sp AH0 N D W AH1 Z T EY1 K AH0 N IH1 N T UW0 DH AH0 F ER1 M N AA1 T AH0 L OW1 N EH1 Z AH0 R IH0 W AO1 R D F R ER0 L AO1 NG AE1 N D F EY1 TH F AH0 L S ER1 V IH0 S}|Mr. Bates had been confidential managing clerk, and was taken into the firm not alone as a reward for long and faithful service.
LJ015-0024|LJSpeech|{B AH1 T DH AE1 T HH IY1 M AY1 T S T R EH1 NG TH AH0 N IH1 T B AY1 HH IH0 Z L AO1 NG IH0 K S P IH1 R IY0 AH0 N S sp AE1 N D N OW1 N B IH1 Z N AH0 S K AH0 P AE1 S AH0 T IY0}|but that he might strengthen it by his long experience and known business capacity.
LJ015-0025|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 B AE1 NG K IH0 N JH OY1 D AE1 N EH1 K S AH0 L AH0 N T R EH2 P Y AH0 T EY1 SH AH0 N sp IH1 T HH AE1 D AH0 G UH1 D K AH0 N EH1 K SH AH0 N sp AH0 N D W AH1 Z S AH0 P OW1 Z D T IH0 B IY1 P ER1 F AH0 K T L IY0 S AW1 N D}|The bank enjoyed an excellent reputation, it had a good connection, and was supposed to be perfectly sound.
LJ015-0026|LJSpeech|{M AO0 R OW1 V ER0 sp DH AH1 P AA1 R T N ER0 Z W ER0 S OW1 B ER0 sp S T EH1 D IY0 M EH1 N sp HH UW1 P EY1 D AH2 N R IH0 M IH1 T IH0 NG AH0 T EH1 N SH AH0 N T IH0 B IH1 Z N IH0 S}|Moreover, the partners were sober, steady men, who paid unremitting attention to business.

LJ015-0028|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 B AE1 NG K W AH1 Z IH0 N S AA1 L V AH0 N T sp AE1 N D IH0 N S T EH1 D AH0 V S T AA1 R T IH0 NG sp AA1 N AH0 F R EH1 SH L AY1 F W IH1 TH EY1 N Y UW1 N EY1 M sp IH1 T SH UH1 D DH EH1 N AE1 N D DH EH1 R HH AE1 V K L OW1 Z D IH0 T S D AO1 R Z}|the bank was insolvent, and instead of starting on a fresh life with a new name, it should then and there have closed its doors.
LJ015-0029|LJSpeech|{IH1 N D IH0 S EH1 M B ER0 sp EY1 T IY1 N F IH1 F T IY0 W AH1 N sp DH AH0 B AE1 L AH0 N S SH IY1 T SH OW1 D sp AH0 D IH0 F IH1 SH AH0 N S IY0 AH1 V AH1 P W ER0 D Z sp AH0 V S EH1 V AH0 N T IY0 TH AW1 Z AH0 N D P AW1 N Z}|In December eighteen fifty-one the balance sheet showed a deficiency of upwards of seventy thousand pounds.

LJ015-0032|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D AA1 N DH IY0 AH1 DH ER0 sp B AY1 B AE1 K IH0 NG AH1 P}|and on the other by backing up.
LJ015-0033|LJSpeech|{AE1 N IH0 M P EH1 K UW1 N IY0 AH0 S AH0 N D R AA1 T AH0 N F ER1 M AH1 V K AA1 N T R AE2 K T ER0 Z sp W IH1 DH V AE1 S T L AY2 AH0 B IH1 L AH0 T IY0 Z sp AH0 N D P L EH1 JH D T UW1 IH0 M P AA1 S AH0 B AH0 L W ER1 K S AH0 B R AO1 D}|an impecunious and rotten firm of contractors with vast liabilities and pledged to impossible works abroad.

LJ015-0035|LJSpeech|{P R AH0 D UW1 S T IH0 M IY1 D IY0 AH0 T IH0 M B EH1 R AH0 S M AH0 N T sp AE1 N D F AY2 N AE1 N SH AH0 L D IH0 S T R EH1 S}|produced immediate embarrassment and financial distress.
LJ015-0036|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 B AE1 NG K W AH0 Z AO0 L R EH1 D IY0 IH0 N S AA1 L V AH0 N T}|The bank was already insolvent,
LJ015-0037|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D DH AH1 P AA1 R T N ER0 Z HH AE1 D T AH0 D IH2 S AY1 D B IH0 T W IY1 N S AH0 S P EH1 N D IH0 NG P EY1 M AH0 N T sp AO1 R K AH0 N T IH1 N Y UW0 IH0 NG T UW1 HH OW1 L D IH0 T S HH EH1 D AH0 B AH1 V W AO1 T ER0 sp B AY1 F L AH0 JH IH1 SH AH0 S sp P R AA1 S EH0 S AH0 Z}|and the partners had to decide between suspending payment or continuing to hold its head above water by flagitious processes.

LJ015-0039|LJSpeech|{M AH1 N IY0 DH EY1 M AH1 S T HH AE1 V sp AE1 N D M AH1 N IY0 DH EY1 R EY1 Z D T UW1 M IY1 T DH EH1 R ER1 JH AH0 N T N AH0 S EH1 S IH0 T IY0 Z sp AH0 P AA1 N DH AH1 B AE1 L AH0 N S IH0 Z AH0 N D S IH0 K Y UH1 R AH0 T IY0 Z D AH0 P AA1 Z IH0 T IH0 D W IH1 DH DH EH1 M B AY1 DH EH1 R K AH1 S T AH0 M ER0 Z}|Money they must have, and money they raised to meet their urgent necessities upon the balances and securities deposited with them by their customers.
LJ015-0040|LJSpeech|{DH IH1 S B AA1 R OW0 IH0 NG K AH0 N T IH1 N Y UW0 D sp AE1 N D AA1 N S AH1 CH AH0 S K EY1 L sp DH AE1 T DH EH1 R P EY1 P ER0 W AH1 Z S UW1 N AE1 T AH0 D IH1 S K AW0 N T}|This borrowing continued, and on such a scale that their paper was soon at a discount,
LJ015-0041|LJSpeech|{AE1 N D DH AH0 V EH1 R IY0 AH0 S D IH1 S K AW0 N T HH AW1 S IH0 Z sp W UH1 D N AA1 T AH0 D V AE1 N S S AH0 F IH1 SH AH0 N T S AH1 M Z T AH0 R IH0 L IY1 V sp DH AH0 N AH0 S EH1 S IH0 T IY0 Z AH0 V DH AH0 B AE1 NG K}|and the various discount houses would not advance sufficient sums to relieve the necessities of the bank.
LJ015-0042|LJSpeech|{DH EH1 N IH1 T W AA1 Z DH AE1 T IH0 N S T EH1 D AH0 V M IH1 R L IY0 P L EH1 JH IH0 NG S IH0 K Y UH1 R AH0 T IY0 Z sp DH AH0 B AE1 NG K S OW1 L D DH AH0 M sp AW1 T R AY1 T sp AE1 N D DH AH1 S sp P AE1 S T DH AH0 R UW1 B IH0 K AO0 N AH0 V F R AO1 D}|Then it was that instead of merely pledging securities, the bank sold them outright, and thus passed the Rubicon of fraud.
LJ015-0043|LJSpeech|{DH IH1 S W EH1 N T AO1 N F R ER0 S AH1 M T AY1 M sp AH0 N D M AY1 T N EH1 V ER0 HH AE1 V B IH1 N D IH0 S K AH1 V ER0 D HH AE1 D S AH1 M G UH1 D S T R OW1 K AH1 V L AH1 K P R AH0 V AY1 D IH0 D EH1 N IY0 AH0 V DH AH1 P AA1 R T N ER0 Z}|This went on for some time, and might never have been discovered had some good stroke of luck provided any of the partners.
LJ015-0044|LJSpeech|{W IH1 DH M AH1 N IY0 sp IH0 N AH1 F T AH0 R IY0 T R IY1 V DH AH0 P AH0 Z IH1 SH AH0 N AH0 V DH AH0 B AE1 NG K sp B AH1 T sp DH AE1 T P AE1 S T F R AH1 M B AE1 D T AH0 W ER1 S}|with money enough to retrieve the position of the bank. But that passed from bad to worse;
LJ015-0045|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 F ER1 M Z P EY1 P ER0 W EH1 N T D AW1 N F ER1 DH ER0 AH0 N D F ER1 DH ER0 IH0 N V AE1 L Y UW0 sp AE1 N AE2 P L AH0 K EY1 SH AH0 N T IH0 DH AH0 K AH0 M IH1 T IY0 AH0 V B AE1 NG K ER0 Z F R ER0 AH0 S IH1 S T AH0 N S sp W AH1 Z sp P ER0 EH1 M P T ER0 AH0 L IY0 R AH0 F Y UW1 Z D}|the firm's paper went down further and further in value; an application to the Committee of Bankers for assistance was peremptorily refused,
LJ015-0046|LJSpeech|{DH EH1 N K EY1 M AH0 R AH1 N AA1 N DH AH0 B AE1 NG K sp AE1 N D sp IH1 T W AH1 Z K AH0 M P EH1 L D sp T IH0 S T AA1 P sp P EY1 M AH0 N T}|then came a run on the bank, and it was compelled to stop payment.
LJ015-0047|LJSpeech|{IH1 T S D EH1 T S AH0 M AW1 N T IH0 D T UW1 TH R IY1 K W AO1 R T ER0 Z AH0 V AH0 M IH1 L Y AH0 N sp AE1 N D DH AH0 D IH1 V IH0 D EH2 N D IH1 T IH0 V EH1 N SH AH0 L IY0 P EY1 D sp W AH0 Z TH R IY1 AE1 N D T UW1 P EH1 N S IH1 N DH AH0 P AW1 N D}|Its debts amounted to three-quarters of a million, and the dividend it eventually paid was three and twopence in the pound.
LJ015-0048|LJSpeech|{B AH1 T W ER1 S DH AE1 N DH AH1 B AE1 NG K R AH0 P T S IY0 sp W AH1 Z DH AH0 K AH0 N F EH1 SH AH0 N M EY1 D B AY1 DH AH1 P AA1 R T N ER0 Z sp IH1 N DH AH1 K AO1 R T}|But worse than the bankruptcy was the confession made by the partners in the court.
LJ015-0049|LJSpeech|{DH EY1 AH0 D M IH1 T AH0 D DH AH0 T DH EY1 HH AE1 D M EY1 D AH0 W EY1 W IH1 TH M EH1 N IY0 AH0 V DH AH0 S IH0 K Y UH1 R AH0 T IY0 Z sp EH0 N T R AH1 S T IH0 D T IH0 DH EH1 R K IY1 P IH0 NG}|They admitted that they had made away with many of the securities entrusted to their keeping.
LJ015-0050|LJSpeech|{F AA1 L OW0 IH0 NG DH IH1 S sp W AO1 R AH0 N T S W ER0 IH1 SH UW0 D F AO1 R DH EH1 R ER0 EH1 S T}|Following this, warrants were issued for their arrest,
LJ015-0051|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 S P IH0 S IH1 F IH0 K CH AA1 R JH B IY1 IH0 NG sp DH IY0 sp AH0 N L AO1 F AH0 L N IH0 G OW2 SH IY0 EY1 SH AH0 N sp AH0 V D EY1 N IH0 SH B AA1 N D Z sp AE1 N D AH1 DH ER0 SH EH1 R Z B IH0 L AO1 NG IH0 NG sp T UW1 DH AH0 R EH1 V R AH0 N D D AA1 K T ER0 G R IH1 F IH0 TH S AH1 V R AA1 CH EH2 S T ER0}|the specific charge being the unlawful negotiation of Danish bonds and other shares belonging to the Rev. Dr. Griffiths of Rochester.
LJ015-0052|LJSpeech|{T UW1 DH AH0 V AE1 L Y UW0 AH0 V T W EH1 N T IY0 TH AW1 Z AH0 N D P AW1 N Z}|to the value of twenty thousand pounds.

LJ015-0055|LJSpeech|{N EH1 K S T M AO1 R N IH0 NG sp DH EY1 OW1 N L IY0 JH AH1 S T S EY1 V D DH AH0 T R EY1 N T IH0 T AW1 N sp AH0 N D L EH1 F T S ER1 JH AA1 N B IH0 HH AY1 N D AO1 N DH AH1 P L AE1 T F AO2 R M sp B AH1 T sp HH IY1 S AH1 B S AH0 K W AH0 N T L IY0 S ER0 EH1 N D ER0 D HH IH0 M S EH1 L F}|Next morning they only just saved the train to town, and left Sir John behind on the platform, but he subsequently surrendered himself.
LJ015-0056|LJSpeech|{M IH1 S T ER0 S T R AE1 HH AH0 N W AH1 Z ER0 EH1 S T IH0 D AE1 T AH0 F R EH1 N D Z HH AW1 S sp IH1 N B R AY1 AH0 N S T AH0 N S K W EH1 R}|Mr. Strahan was arrested at a friend's house in Bryanston Square.
LJ015-0057|LJSpeech|{AO1 L TH R IY1 W ER0 T R AY1 D AE1 T DH AH0 S EH1 N T R AH0 L K R IH1 M AH0 N AH0 L K AO1 R T sp AH0 N D S EH1 N T AH0 N S T T AH0 F AO1 R T IY1 N Y IH1 R Z T R AE2 N S P ER0 T EY1 SH AH0 N sp P AE1 S IH0 NG S AH1 M T AY1 M IH1 N N UW1 G EY0 T sp EH1 N R UW1 T}|All three were tried at the Central Criminal Court, and sentenced to fourteen years' transportation, passing some time in Newgate en route.
LJ015-0058|LJSpeech|{B EY1 T S sp DH AH0 L IY1 S T G IH1 L T IY0 sp W AH1 Z P AA1 R D AH0 N D sp IH1 N EY1 T IY1 N F IH1 F T IY0 EY1 T}|Bates, the least guilty, was pardoned in eighteen fifty-eight.
LJ015-0059|LJSpeech|{T UW1 K EY1 S IH0 Z AH1 V IH0 K S T EH1 N S IH0 V EH0 M B EH1 Z AH0 L M AH0 N T sp W IH1 CH W ER1 D IH0 S K AH1 V ER0 D AO1 L M OW2 S T S AY2 M AH0 L T EY1 N IY0 AH0 S L IY0 sp DH OW1 Z AH0 V R AA1 B S AH0 N AE1 N D R EH1 D P AE2 TH}|Two cases of extensive embezzlement which were discovered almost simultaneously, those of Robson and Redpath,
LJ015-0060|LJSpeech|{W AH0 L L AO1 NG B IY0 R IH0 M EH1 M B ER0 D B OW1 TH W IH0 DH IH1 N AE1 N D W IH0 DH AW1 T DH AH0 K AH0 M ER1 SH AH0 L W ER1 L D}|will long be remembered both within and without the commercial world.
LJ015-0061|LJSpeech|{DH EY1 B OW1 TH R IY2 P R AH0 D UW1 S T M EH1 N IY0 AH0 V DH AH0 F IY1 CH ER0 Z AH0 V DH AH0 K EY1 S AH0 V W AA1 T S AO0 L R EH1 D IY0 D IH0 S K R AY1 B D}|They both reproduced many of the features of the case of Watts, already described,

LJ028-0008|LJSpeech|{Y UW1 T AE1 P JH EH1 N T L IY0 W IH1 TH Y UH1 R HH IY1 L AH0 P AA1 N DH AH0 SH OW1 L D ER0 AH0 V DH AH0 D R AA1 M AH0 D EH2 R IY0 T AH0 ER1 JH HH ER0 AO1 N}|you tap gently with your heel upon the shoulder of the dromedary to urge her on.

LJ028-0012|LJSpeech|{SH IY1 R IY1 AH0 L AY2 Z IH0 Z DH AH0 T SH IY1 IH1 Z B AW1 N D AA1 N DH AH1 L AO1 NG JH ER1 N IY0 AH0 K R AO1 S DH AH0 D EH1 Z ER0 T sp AW1 R AE1 F T ER0 AW1 R sp SH IY1 B EH1 R Z Y UW1 OW1 V ER0 DH AH1 HH AA1 R D sp M AH0 N AA1 T AH0 N AH0 S P L EY1 N}|she realizes that she is bound on the long journey across the desert. LJ028-0013|LJSpeech|{DH AH0 D AH0 M AE1 S K AH0 S M AA1 S K S AE1 N D DH EH1 R M IH2 N ER0 EH1 T S sp S IH1 NG K B IH0 N IY1 TH DH AH1 W EH1 S T ER0 N S K AY1}|The Damascus mosques and their minarets sink beneath the western sky.

LJ028-0060|LJSpeech|{IH1 N S IH1 K S OW1 F AY1 V}|In six oh five,
